bibl.title: George W. Anderson vs. John H. McGraw. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territoru holding terms at Seattle, for King County
In the matter of the application of George W. Anderson for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable C. H. Hanford, Chief Justice of the Territory of Washington, and Judge of the District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

The petition of George W. Anderson respectfully shows: That your petitioner is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined, and restrained of his liberty by John H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory, at the County Jail of said King County in the City of Seattle in said county
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement, and restraint, an illegal; and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to=wit: that said confinement is without due process of law
Wherefore your petitioner prays that a
